Name: Statue of Standing Woman, Possibly a Queen
Description: Still bearing traces of the paint with which it was covered, this statue portrays a woman standing on a small base with her left leg slightly forward. She wears a long three-part wig and a long dress. Her right arm is by her side. Her left arm is bent below her chest. She is holding a floral scepter in her hand, a typical pose of queens. She might have been a Ptolemaic queen from the first half of the third century BC.
